title: Dance Health and Injury Prevention
description: An overview of factors that affect the health of dancers. Includes evaluation of general health measures and prevention and management of common dance injuries.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Scientific Concepts of Health
description: Introduction to the scientific foundations of health, emphasizing those pertaining to success in college and lifetime wellness. Includes principles of cardiorespiratory, musculoskeletal, flexibility, and nutritional fitness. A variety of learning experiences are offered to apply science to real life.

title: Social Dance
description: Contemporary and historical forms.  Current ballroom, disco, and Western square dance forms; Latin ballroom dances; dances from the 20s, 30s, and 40s.

title: Music for Dancers
description: Emphasis on the development of musical skills most pertinent to the dancer: vocabulary, notational literacy, rhythmic and melodic acuity, score reading, and fundamental analysis; working with live accompaniment.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Studio Workshop in Ballet I
description: Beginning ballet: fundamentals and principles of classical ballet with an emphasis on technique.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

title: Choreography
description: Beginning-to-intermediate study of principles of dance composition.  May include composition assignments for stage and video.  By audition, works may be shown quarterly in public studio performances.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Choreography
description: Beginning-to-intermediate study of principles of dance composition.  May include composition assignments for stage and video.  By audition, works may be shown quarterly in public studio performances.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Choreography
description: Beginning-to-intermediate study of principles of dance composition.  May include composition assignments for stage and video.  By audition, works may be shown quarterly in public studio performances.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Introduction to Ballet and Modern Dance
description: Survey of nineteenth and twentieth-century ballet, modern dance, and theatre dance.
restriction: Non-major only.

title: American Ballet and Modern Dance since 1900
description: A survey of American ballet and modern dance in the twentieth and twenty-first centuries. Lectures are supplemented by video.
restriction: Non-major only. Dance 81 and Dance 90C may not both be taken for credit.

title: Topics in World Dance
description: Various topics in world dance studies focusing on historical, social, and cultural contexts.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Dance in Feature Film
description: Dance in film musicals and commercial dance films, concentrating especially on films from the 1930s through the 1970s.

title: What Dance Does: From Ballet to Hip-Hop
description: Explores the way dance reflects culture and embodies new ideas. Examples for viewing and analysis come from ballet (with roots in Europe) and hip-hop (with roots in the African diaspora). Themes include gender, perceived racial difference, identity.

title: Dance History I
description: Global perspectives.  Topics and histories of dance and movement practices from various parts of the world.
restriction: Dance Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Dance - Choreography Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Dance - Performance Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

title: Dance History II
description: The history of dance in the western tradition from the Renaissance through the 19th century.
restriction: Dance Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Dance - Choreography Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Dance - Performance Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

title: Dance History III
description: The history of dance in the western tradition in the the 20th and 21st centuries.
restriction: Dance Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Dance - Choreography Majors have first consideration for enrollment. Dance - Performance Majors have first consideration for enrollment.

title: Kinesiology for Dance
description: The study of the production of dance movement by the musculoskeletal system. Anatomical and dynamic analysis of dance movement.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Pilates
description: Basics of technique emphasizing alignment, breath control, correction of muscular imbalances.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

title: Pilates Reformer
description: Utilizes the Universal Reformer apparatus, aiding the student in core stabilization, correcting muscular imbalances, increasing flexibility, and improving strength.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: World Dance
description: Studio workshop of dances and movement sources of specified countries or areas.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 6 times as topics vary.

title: Teaching of Dance
description: Pedagogy.  The methods and theory of teaching dance forms.
prerequisite: DANCE 133A and DANCE 133B and DANCE 133C and DANCE 143A and DANCE 143B and DANCE 143C
restriction: Upper-division students only. Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Costume Design for Dance
description: Costume design and construction specific to the body in motion. Theoretical study and practical execution.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Improvisation
description: Structured and experiential improvisation to heighten the personal intuitive processes, the kinesthetic sense, spatial and temporal awareness, and to encourage insights into the potential movement resources of the individual for performance and choreography.  Course encourages freedom of exploration.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

title: Choreography II
description: Directed choreographic projects for stage or video integrating the elements of stagecraft.  In process or completed works may be shown quarterly in public studio or stage performances.
prerequisite: DANCE 60A and DANCE 60B and DANCE 60C. Audition required.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Choreography II
description: Directed choreographic projects for stage or video integrating the elements of stagecraft.  In process or completed works may be shown quarterly in public studio or stage performances.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Choreography II
description: Directed choreographic projects for stage or video integrating the elements of stagecraft.  In process or completed works may be shown quarterly in public studio or stage performances.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Dance and Video Technology
description: Introduction to video and audio documentation of dance performance. Integrating dance performance within the film aesthetic. Techniques and technologies of video cameras, formats, editing, and projection. Overview of video compression and DVD authoring.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Screendance
description: Overview of dance for film and choreography for the camera. Aesthetics of creating dance for the screen. Approaches for delivery of dance films to an audience, including projection, DVD, Web, and mobile devices. A final dance film project is required.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Choreographic Projects
description: Supervised choreographic projects for workshop productions.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

title: Dance Performance
description: Rehearsal and performance in a faculty-choreographed production.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Dance Workshop
description: Rehearsal and performance in a student-choreographed production.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Master of Fine Arts Concert
description: Rehearsal and performance in a graduate student-choreographed production.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: UCI Dance Ensemble Performance
description: Performance with the UCI Dance Ensemble.
restriction: Sophomores only. Upper-division students only.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 6 times.

title: UCI Jazz Dance Ensemble
description: Rehearsal and performance in theatrical jazz dance, designed to provide an experience in assimilating various styles of jazz dance and in refining dance performance techniques.  Students will master aspects of dance company promotion.
restriction: Sophomores only. Upper-division students only.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 6 times.

title: Performance Laboratory
description: Rehearsal and performance of graduate student-choreographed dance works for the M.F.A. thesis.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: UCI Etude Ensemble
description: Repertory and performances by undergraduate Dance majors. Concert presentations on and off campus. Faculty directed, student/faculty choreographed.
restriction: Sophomores only. Upper-division students only.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 9 times.

title: Laban Studies
description: Laban movement analysis.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Critical Issues in Dance
description: Critical thinking and writing about dance, with a section on dance criticism and a major emphasis on persuasive writing about significant issues in the dance world.
prerequisite: DANCE 90A and DANCE 90B and DANCE 90C. Satisfactory completion of the lower-division writing requirement.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.

title: Selected Topics in Dance
description: Directed group studies of topics in dance.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 3 times as topics vary.

title: Topics Vary
description: Seminar in Dance Studies. Variable topics related to gender, race, politics, and dance writing, and criticism, with attention to linking dance practices to the wider world.
repeatability: Unlimited as topics vary.

title: Arts Management
description: Designed for students interested in the developmental and management of nonprofit arts organizations.  Examines the organizational structure and areas of operation such as marketing, fundraising, budgeting, production, and administration.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times.

title: Independent Study
description: Individual independent projects in experimental laboratory, library, field, performance, under instructor's direction. Students can receive conceptual, creative, and theoretical instruction in the successful completion of a written report or performance.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Senior Thesis
description: Directed research or creative activity for senior Dance majors.  Research consists of a substantial essay on dance history, research in dance science, or the creation of original or reconstructed choreography.
restriction: Dance Majors only. Dance - Choreography Majors only. Dance - Performance Majors only.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Seminar in Kinesiology for Dance
description: Introduction to the anatomical, biomechanical, and physiological principles of dance movement.

title: Musical Resources
description: Detailed study of music as it relates to dance. Historical overview of musical form, style, and other elements.  Analysis of various affinities between music and dance.  Practical applications.

title: Seminar in the Teaching of Dance Techniques
description: Principles and theories of teaching dance techniques. Supervised presentation and teaching of technique class.

title: Graduate Studio: Ballet
description: Advanced ballet, pointe work, and performance style: principles of the classical ballet with an emphasis on technique.
restriction: Audition required.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Graduate Studio: Tap
description: An overview of tap concentrating on the development of various technique forms using basic and intermediate principles.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 4 times.

description: An overview of tap concentrating on the development of various technique forms using basic and intermediate principles.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 4 times.

repeatability: May be taken for credit 4 times.

title: Graduate Studio in Choreography
description: Graduate work in dance composition emphasizing the individual aesthetic.  Assignments in movement discovery, solo and group forms, with the main emphasis on independent work.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Graduate Studio in Choreography
description: Graduate work in dance composition emphasizing the individual aesthetic.  Assignments in movement discovery, solo and group forms, with the main emphasis on independent work.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: Screendance
description: Overview of dance for film and choreography for the camera. Aesthetics of creating dance for the screen. Approaches for delivery of dance films to an audience, including projection, DVD, Web, and mobile devices. A final dance film project is required.

title: Dance and Video Technology
description: Introduction to video and audio documentation of dance performance. Integrating dance performance within the film aesthetic. Techniques and technologies of video cameras, formats, editing, and projection. Overview of video compression and DVD authoring.

title: Seminar in Movement Analysis
description: Theories of movement analysis and nonverbal communication applied to dance.

title: Critical Issues in Dance
description: Reading, writing, discussing, and presenting key issues that relate to dance studies.  Basics of dance analysis and criticism.  Special emphasis on effective ways of defining, clarifying, and arguing for points of view.

title: Bibliography and Research
description: Understanding the field of dance studies, available resources, research methods, and academic formats in preparation for thesis writing.

title: Graduate Projects
description: Projects may be educational, choreographic, scientific, historical, or philosophical in scope and must have faculty advisor approval.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 6 times.

title: Thesis
description: Substantial research in a topic approved by the student's graduate committee.  Results of the research must be written in approved thesis style.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 6 times.

title: Graduate Lectures in Dance
description: A series of lectures and discussions of announced topics in dance. Content may be from history, ethnology, notation, medicine, music, or other areas in the field.
repeatability: Unlimited as topics vary.

title: Proseminar in Dance History
description: Discussion seminar with emphasis on reading and thinking about problems in dance history; presentation of oral and written reports.
repeatability: May be taken for credit 2 times as topics vary.

title: Directed Reading
description: Topic to be approved by instructor.  Paper required.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.

title: University Teaching
description: Limited to Teaching Assistants.
restriction: Graduate students only. Dance Majors only.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.
